pageWording: Distribute or sell food locally
Sell more than 2 tonnes of meat each week
Distrubute food nationally or internationally
Is a hypermarket or superstore
Serves customers living outside the local area. For example it is located at motorway services or at an airport.
summaryWording: Serves customers living outside the local area

pageWording: Sell food online
Serve less than 20 people each day
Grade eggs
Serve more than 20 people each day
Package and fille, slice, skin, mince, freeze or process seafood
Manufacture high risk ready to eat food. For example smoothies, meat pies or liquid egg.
summarywording: Manufacture high risk ready to eat food

pageWording: Pack only low risk food. Such as drinks, crisps or other shelf stable items.
Deliver food to customers
Re-wrap or re-pack high risk food. For example sandwhiches, meat or cheese.
summaryWording: Re-wrap or re-pack high risk food

pageWording: Only sell low risk food that can be stored at room tempretature. For example pre-packed snacks or drinks.
summaryWording: Only sell low risk food stored at room tempretature

pageWording: Cook, handle or prepare high risk food. For example sandwiches, meat or soup.
summaryWording: Cook, handle or prepare high risk food

pageWording: Sell raw milk
Sell or handle high risk pre-packed food. For example meat, sandwiches or scooped ice cream.
summaryWording: Sell or handle high risk pre-packed food

pageWording: Only sell raw meat and food that can be stored at room temperature
Handle or sell pre-packed high risk food. For example sandwiches, meat or cheese.
summaryWording: Handle or sell pre-packed high risk food

pageWording: Vend high risk pre packed food. For example sandwiches
Vend made to order high risk food. For example pizza or soup
summaryWording: Vend made to order high risk food

pageWording: Only sell raw fish or food that can be stored at room temperature
Prepare and sell high risk food, such as sandwiches, meat or soup, but serve less than 20 people a day
summaryWording: Prepare and sell high risk food, but serve less than 20 people a day

pageWording: Only make low risk products. For example jams, chutneys, sponge cakes, biscuits or cookies.
Pasteurise or use other shelf life extending methods
Only use pasteurised milk or milk powder
Vacuum pack food
Process and supply seafood to other businesses
Cook and prepare own hams
Serve undercooked or raw meat or fish. For example rare burgers, sushi or tartare.
summaryWording: Serve undercooked or raw meat or fish

pageWording: Also operate a cook chill operation
Use specialist processing methods. For example sous-vide cooking, cooking with acid or vacuum packing foods.
Serve food to elderly or children under five years
Serve more than 20 people per day from vulnerable groups. For example the sick or the elderly.
summaryWording: Serve more than 20 people per day from vulnerable groups

pageWording: Provide only drinks and low risk snacks. For example fruit or crisps
summaryWording: Provide only drinks and low risk snacks
